params._guardian: Address that can pause deposits and withdrawals.

params._data: Data to trigger the recipient with.
params._gasLimit: Minimum L2 gas limit (can be greater than or equal to this value).
params._isCreation: Whether or not the transaction is a contract creation.
params._value: ETH value to send to the recipient.

params._l2OutputIndex: Index of the L2 output to check.

returns._0: Whether or not the output is finalized.

params._l2OutputIndex: L2 output index to prove against.
params._outputRootProof: Inclusion proof of the L2ToL1MessagePasser contract's storage root.
params._withdrawalProof: Inclusion proof of the withdrawal in L2ToL1MessagePasser contract.

returns._0: Semver contract version as a string.

BASE_FEE_MAX_CHANGE_DENOMINATOR().notice: Denominator that determines max change on fee per block.

ELASTICITY_MULTIPLIER().notice: Along with the resource limit, determines the target resource limit.

GUARDIAN().notice: Address that has the ability to pause and unpause deposits and withdrawals.

MAXIMUM_BASE_FEE().notice: Maximum base fee value, cannot go higher than this.

MAX_RESOURCE_LIMIT().notice: Maximum amount of the resource that can be used within this block.

MINIMUM_BASE_FEE().notice: Minimum base fee value, cannot go lower than this.

TARGET_RESOURCE_LIMIT().notice: Target amount of the resource that should be used within this block.

depositTransaction(address,uint256,uint6.notice: Accepts deposits of ETH and data, and emits a TransactionDeposited event for use in         deriving deposit transactions. Note that if a deposit is made by a contract, its         address will be aliased when retrieved using `tx.origin` or `msg.sender`. Consider         using the CrossDomainMessenger contracts for a simpler developer experience.

donateETH().notice: Accepts ETH value without triggering a deposit to L2. This function mainly exists         for the sake of the migration between the legacy Mantle system and Bedrock.

finalizedWithdrawals(bytes32).notice: A list of withdrawal hashes which have been successfully finalized.

isOutputFinalized(uint256).notice: Determine if a given output is finalized. Reverts if the call to         L2_ORACLE.getL2Output reverts. Returns a boolean otherwise.

l2Sender().notice: Address of the L2 account which initiated a withdrawal in this transaction. If the         of this variable is the default L2 sender address, then we are NOT inside of a call         to finalizeWithdrawalTransaction.

paused().notice: Determines if cross domain messaging is paused. When set to true,         deposits and withdrawals are paused. This may be removed in the         future.

provenWithdrawals(bytes32).notice: A mapping of withdrawal hashes to `ProvenWithdrawal` data.

version().notice: Returns the full semver contract version.

BASE_FEE_MAX_CHANGE_DENOMINATOR().notice: Denominator that determines max change on fee per block.

ELASTICITY_MULTIPLIER().notice: Along with the resource limit, determines the target resource limit.

GUARDIAN().notice: Address that has the ability to pause and unpause deposits and withdrawals.

MAXIMUM_BASE_FEE().notice: Maximum base fee value, cannot go higher than this.

MAX_RESOURCE_LIMIT().notice: Maximum amount of the resource that can be used within this block.

MINIMUM_BASE_FEE().notice: Minimum base fee value, cannot go lower than this.

TARGET_RESOURCE_LIMIT().notice: Target amount of the resource that should be used within this block.

depositTransaction(address,uint256,uint6.notice: Accepts deposits of ETH and data, and emits a TransactionDeposited event for use in         deriving deposit transactions. Note that if a deposit is made by a contract, its         address will be aliased when retrieved using `tx.origin` or `msg.sender`. Consider         using the CrossDomainMessenger contracts for a simpler developer experience.

donateETH().notice: Accepts ETH value without triggering a deposit to L2. This function mainly exists         for the sake of the migration between the legacy Mantle system and Bedrock.

finalizedWithdrawals(bytes32).notice: A list of withdrawal hashes which have been successfully finalized.

isOutputFinalized(uint256).notice: Determine if a given output is finalized. Reverts if the call to         L2_ORACLE.getL2Output reverts. Returns a boolean otherwise.

l2Sender().notice: Address of the L2 account which initiated a withdrawal in this transaction. If the         of this variable is the default L2 sender address, then we are NOT inside of a call         to finalizeWithdrawalTransaction.

paused().notice: Determines if cross domain messaging is paused. When set to true,         deposits and withdrawals are paused. This may be removed in the         future.

provenWithdrawals(bytes32).notice: A mapping of withdrawal hashes to `ProvenWithdrawal` data.

version().notice: Returns the full semver contract version.

Paused(address).notice: Emitted when the pause is triggered.

TransactionDeposited(address,address,uin.notice: Emitted when a transaction is deposited from L1 to L2. The parameters of this event         are read by the rollup node and used to derive deposit transactions on L2.

Unpaused(address).notice: Emitted when the pause is lifted.

WithdrawalFinalized(bytes32,bool).notice: Emitted when a withdrawal transaction is finalized.

WithdrawalProven(bytes32,address,address.notice: Emitted when a withdrawal transaction is proven.

userdoc.notice: The MantlePortal is a low-level contract responsible for passing messages between L1         and L2. Messages sent directly to the MantlePortal have no form of replayability.         Users are encouraged to use the L1CrossDomainMessenger for a higher-level interface.

params._guardian: Address that can pause deposits and withdrawals.

params._data: Data to trigger the recipient with.
params._gasLimit: Minimum L2 gas limit (can be greater than or equal to this value).
params._isCreation: Whether or not the transaction is a contract creation.
params._value: ETH value to send to the recipient.

params._l2OutputIndex: Index of the L2 output to check.

returns._0: Whether or not the output is finalized.

params._l2OutputIndex: L2 output index to prove against.
params._outputRootProof: Inclusion proof of the L2ToL1MessagePasser contract's storage root.
params._withdrawalProof: Inclusion proof of the withdrawal in L2ToL1MessagePasser contract.

returns._0: Semver contract version as a string.

params.account: Address of the account triggering the pause.

params.from: Address that triggered the deposit transaction.
params.opaqueData: ABI encoded deposit data to be parsed off-chain.
params.to: Address that the deposit transaction is directed to.
params.version: Version of this deposit transaction event.

params.account: Address of the account triggering the unpause.

params.success: Whether the withdrawal transaction was successful.

documentation.text: @notice Version of the deposit event.
@notice The L2 gas limit set when eth is deposited using the receive() function.
@notice Additional gas reserved for clean up after finalizing a transaction withdrawal.
@notice Address of the L2OutputOracle.
@notice Address that has the ability to pause and unpause deposits and withdrawals.
@notice A list of withdrawal hashes which have been successfully finalized.
@notice A mapping of withdrawal hashes to `ProvenWithdrawal` data.

@notice Emitted when a withdrawal transaction is proven.
 @param withdrawalHash Hash of the withdrawal transaction.

@notice Emitted when the pause is triggered.
 @param account Address of the account triggering the pause.

@notice Emitted when the pause is lifted.
 @param account Address of the account triggering the unpause.

arguments.value: MantlePortal: paused

documentation.text: @notice Reverts when paused.
@notice Initializer.

arguments.value: MantlePortal: only guardian can pause

documentation.text: @notice Pause deposits and withdrawals.

arguments.value: MantlePortal: only guardian can unpause

documentation.text: @notice Unpause deposits and withdrawals.

arguments.value: false

documentation.text:
@notice Accepts value so that users can send ETH directly to this contract and have the
         funds be deposited to their address on L2. This is intended as a convenience
         function for EOAs. Contracts should call the depositTransaction() function directly
         otherwise any deposited funds will be lost due to address aliasing.

@notice Accepts ETH value without triggering a deposit to L2. This function mainly exists
         for the sake of the migration between the legacy Mantle system and Bedrock.
